2.text: Hear attentively my speech, and let this replace your consolations.

3.text: Suffer me and I will speak; and after I have spoken, mock on!

4.text: As for me, is my complaint to a man? or wherefore should not my spirit be impatient?

5.text: Mark me, and be astonished, and lay the hand upon the mouth.

6.text: Even when I think [thereon], I am affrighted, and trembling taketh hold of my flesh.

7.text: Wherefore do the wicked live, grow old, yea, become mighty in power?

8.text: Their seed is established with them in their sight, and their offspring before their eyes.

9.text: Their houses are safe from fear, neither is the rod of +God upon them.

10.text: Their bull gendereth, and faileth not; their cow calveth, and casteth not her calf.

11.text: They send forth their little ones like a flock, and their children dance.

12.text: They shout to the tambour and harp, and rejoice at the sound of the pipe.

13.text: They spend their days in prosperity, and in a moment go down to Sheol.

14.text: And they say unto God, Depart from us, for we desire not the knowledge of thy ways!

15.text: What is the Almighty that we should serve him? and what are we profited if we pray unto him?

16.text: Behold, their prosperity is not in their hand. The counsel of the wicked be far from me!

17.text: How often is the lamp of the wicked put out, and cometh their calamity upon them? Doth he distribute sorrows [to them] in his anger?

18.text: Do they become as stubble before the wind, and as chaff that the storm carrieth away?

19.text: +God layeth up [the punishment of] his iniquity for his children; he rewardeth him, and he shall know [it]:

20.text: His eyes shall see his destruction, and he shall drink of the fury of the Almighty.

21.text: For what pleasure should he have in his house after him, when the number of his months is cut off?

22.text: Can any teach God knowledge? And he it is that judgeth those that are high.

23.text: One dieth in his full strength, being wholly at ease and quiet;

24.text: His sides are full of fat, and the marrow of his bones is moistened;

25.text: And another dieth in bitterness of soul, and hath not tasted good:

26.text: Together they lie down in the dust, and the worms cover them.

27.text: Lo, I know your thoughts, and the devices ye wrongfully imagine against me.

28.text: For ye say, Where is the house of the noble? and where the tent of the dwellings of the wicked?

29.text: Have ye not asked the wayfarers? and do ye not regard their tokens:

30.text: That the wicked is reserved for the day of calamity? They are led forth to the day of wrath.

31.text: Who shall declare his way to his face? and who shall repay him what he hath done?

32.text: Yet is he carried to the graves, and watch is kept over the tomb.

33.text: The clods of the valley are sweet unto him; and every man followeth suit after him, as there were innumerable before him.

34.text: How then comfort ye me in vain? Your answers remain perfidious.
